developerResponse: {'id': 11535024, 'body': "Hi Galarnyk - Thank you for providing feedback on BPme Rewards. We very much value your business and we take your feedback seriously. We'll continue to look for ways to improve the experience for our best consumers.\r Thank you BP\n", 'modified': '2019-10-29T14:33:57Z'}
review:
It took me a few minutes of navigating the app to figure out that I could view all gas stations on a map- this should be the first thing I can see when I enter the app (have a button really obvious- rather than have to find it as the fifth option down after clicking on the top left hamburger navigation button). 

It would also be really useful to see a price spread between locations that are nearby.

Note that when creating an account we are asked to provide email address, First name, last name, and zip code. Why should I have to provide all this upon first opening the app, can't this be obtained easily from entering credit card info?

Lastly, the button shown to customer "Fill up today to start earning rewards" spins with a loading message when clicked and then goes back to default message- no idea what purpose this serves other than to think it is broken. 

All in all I think this app could be really useful but requires some user experience consideration if it is to be adopted by the masses, or at least some first time download account credit or credit for referring other users to use the app.
title: Ok- a few small tweaks would be useful.

developerResponse: {'id': 7050095, 'body': 'Hi, we’re sorry to hear of your experience and want to help make things right. For questions or issues related to rewards and/or promotions, please contact the customer support team at 1-877-852-3025 or at https://www.mybpstation.com/contact-us and reference this review - we are more than happy to investigate your case!', 'modified': '2019-01-28T17:48:01Z'}
review:
This app made lots of promises in the introductory email however it’s failed to fulfill any of them. 

I was promised a $.25 bonus for trying the app but when I attempted to use it at the station in my neighborhood I learned that it did not work there. In fact the closest station was 35 miles away so I made the trek only to pay an additional $.30 per gallon above my local stations price. At least I was able to experience the potential convenience the app could offer. 

After my purchase I received an email congratulating me on using the app and earning the $.25 bonus. When I didn’t see the bonus reflected in my balance I contacted customer support. After 4 unanswered inquiries I was disappointed to learn that BP decided to cancel the bonus they congratulated me for earning because they deemed my purchase insufficient to remit the bonus. 

Sadly I will no longer purchase my fuel at BP after I use my rewards balance and instead of sharing the benefits of the app’s safety (the BP station I frequent at the entrance to my community was recently found to have card readers that steal your credit card info which made me eager to share the app as an option at my next community meeting) and convenience I’ll be sharing my dissatisfaction with my network. 

It’s unfortunate that the app wasn’t better planned prior to making it available to regular customers.
title: Rather Worthless

developerResponse:
{'id': 11535738, 'body': 'Hi igero - BP continues to review support for additional payment options and will continue to work towards expanding payment options through BPme. 

For your awareness, after you enter your credit card into the app, your personal and card details are never stored directly on your phone, in the event that your phone is ever lost or stolen, your card information would not be accessible from the app. The app also requires additional security features such as a passcode and security questions to prevent others from accessing your app and using your phone to pay for fuel. 

If you would like to receive fuel discounts without joining the program, you can if your phone allows you to receive text messages. To join our SMS offers program, where we will distribute weekly promotional codes that can be used for a fuel discount text REWARDS to 38831, and reply Y to be signed up for offers when you receive a response. Another option is to use BP Credit Card program that allows allow you to get cents off per gallon rewards that are taken automatically at the pump!

review: This app seemed really cool when I set it up at home, but when I went to fill up, I found that it takes way too long to connect to the pump. I could have used my credit card twice in the same amount of time it took for the pump and the app to sync. Additionally, using the app forced me to pay the credit price for gas, even though I had a debit card connected to the app. So I ended up just canceling the app purchase and using my debit card anyway. Altogether a good concept, but terrible execution. Overall a complete waste of time and energy.
title: Takes too long ask & forces you to pay cash price

developerResponse: {'id': 11579233, 'body': 'Hi Hina khan 01 - We apologize for this experience. The BPme app is a secure method of payment, and credit card details are never stored in the app itself. We take our members’ data security very seriously and would be happy to talk with you regarding this situation.\nThe 0.00 charge from Naperville, IL is entirely expected behavior and not fraud. The Zero Dollar authorization is used to validate your account when provisioning your credit card. It generates from Naperville, IL where BP America has offices, because the transaction is tied to the BPme App and not an individual retail location. If additional information, please give us a call at 800-333-3991. Thank you, BPme Team\n', 'modified': '2019-10-31T13:37:56Z'}
review: My card was hacked because of this app lol. Someone tried to use it in Illinois for gas at bp.
title: Hacked account

developerResponse: {'id': 7625673, 'body': 'We’re glad you love it as much as we do.', 'modified': '2019-03-07T17:32:19Z'}
review: I love the bp app it makes filling up so easy! Compared with other gas apps you don’t have to use the pin pad which is great! So easy and convenient!
title: Amazing app

developerResponse: {'id': 7625665, 'body': 'Unfortunately, the BPme app doesn’t accept debit as a form of payment quite yet. If you add a debit card into the app today it will process as credit. We are working to make enhancements to the app and this is one of them. Thank you for your feedback!', 'modified': '2019-03-07T17:31:24Z'}
review: Many BP gas stations near me are 10 cents cheaper,  in addition to BP rewards, if you use debit or cash. Although I linked a debit card I do not receive this 10 cents off credit rendering this app an unwise financial decision for me in the NY Metro area. Should be more like Cumberland Farms app. They got it right.
title: Paying More

developerResponse: {'id': 7625661, 'body': 'Unfortunately, the BPme app doesn’t accept debit as a form of payment quite yet. If you add a debit card into the app today it will process as credit. We are working to make enhancements to the app and this is one of them. Thank you for your feedback!', 'modified': '2019-03-07T17:31:13Z'}
review: This app really needs to relay to the pump when a debit card is being used. If my debit card is setup on the app, when I pump gas I should be charged the debit price not the credit price. This is a great tool to use since there are so many scams out there with card skimming. This really needs to be addressed. It completely defeats the purpose of not having to swipe your card. A 20¢ difference adds up per gallon. You guys really need to look into this to make this a better experience. Don’t allow another company to come in and do this before you do.
title: Debit/Credit

If you wish to speak with someone, give us a call 1-877-852-3025.  Any additional information we can get about the problem will be helpful!  Thanks, JS', 'modified': '2019-03-07T15:31:39Z'}
review: The ideal of the app is great! I can pull up to the pump and activate it with just my phone. However I’ve been experiencing trouble using it. The very first time worked fine.  Is when I open the app the debit card I registered is missing and I can no longer add debit or credit cards. You will also get charged the credit price which is really unfortunate steering you away from using the app. However since my debit card was linked to my rewards account. Every time I use this debit card the pump ask me do I want to apply my rewards and my rewards account is forever associated with my debit card so I still get my rewards and the debit price using my card. So great but fixed the app PLEASE!! I like BP so I want to use it. Also with the receipt it would be nice if you could print it or download them in pdf format.
title: It’s okay but flawed

developerResponse: {'id': 11535658, 'body': 'Hi LylacRain - Fuel prices are displayed on the entrance to BP or Amoco sites and at all of the pumps. BP and Amoco sites are independently owned and operated and set their own prices, including terms for different payment methods. When using the BPme app to purchase fuel, you will always be charged the stated credit card price. To receive any other prices (debit card pricing or discounts for specific credit card brands) that are offered by the stations, you cannot use the BPme app. Rather, you must use your actual linked payment card at the station. Any qualifying purchases will be counted in BPme Rewards.\r Hope this helps! Thank you BP\n', 'modified': '2019-10-29T15:16:27Z'}

review:
I have been trying for over an hour to log in with my credentials from my years old BP rewards account and I keep getting a “sorry your session has timed out” message after I want to say the full 7 seconds it takes to sign in. 🤷🏽‍♀️

I wouldn’t have an issue with the credit price thing people keep complaining about- that’s not new, the station doesn’t know/care you are using your debit as a credit card. They have to pay the transaction fee nonetheless. You can choose a station that is “cash/credit same price”. 

Hopefully the developer team will fix the bugs so that more people will use what seems to be a great idea.

title: It’s good but I want my receipt

developerResponse: {'id': 7810051, 'body': 'Hi Ben.T-S, we are sorry you are having an issue with your cards.  If you wish to speak to someone, please get in touch at https://www.mybpstation.com/contact-us or call 1-877-852-3025.  Let’s see if we can get this resolved and get you back to fueling with BPme.  Thanks, The BPme Team', 'modified': '2019-03-19T19:46:19Z'}
review:
Loved the idea, the convenience and the ease of use of this app up until the moment it stopped working earlier this week.  I pulled into my regular BP station and the add told me that my cc was no good (which is not true). I deleted it, intending to add it again and try over, but no dice!   I couldn’t add ANY form of payment into the app, rendering it useless.  I’ve tried several times over the past few days, with different cards, rebooted my phone, etc. no luck. Now I have 18c/gallon off points that I can’t use and a low-level frustration with BP for getting me to love something, only to take it away... :: sad face ::

UPDATE: so after calling the number suggested in the response from BP I was told that their system was offline and they couldn’t help me... would I mind calling back later? Offline experience was eerily similar to online.  Ironic.   Of course, forgot to call back for a few days but when I finally did I was told I had to email BP to get my account “unlocked.”  So I did that right away, with no acknowledgement or response for a couple of weeks. After I followed up (twice) they did respond that the app was finally unlocked and, sure enough, I could add my credit card again. Hallelujah!  Amirite?  No.  Not right. When i got to the gas station (where the app had worked fine until it didn’t) I did the usual fumbling with my phone to log in and select the pump #, then BOOM! Same error message about that form of payment not working.  ffs, people. I’m not sure what it says about me as a person that I’ll stay loyal to BP through the whole Deepwater Horizon fiasco but this makes me want to switch to another brand, but I don’t think it’s good.  Down to 1 Star you go, BPme.
title: Loved it, but then it stopped working

developerResponse: {'id': 8452228, 'body': 'Thanks for the review, midwestwarrior13.  You’re the best!', 'modified': '2019-04-30T16:06:13Z'}
review: When I first tried the app, the location I was at didn’t have the capability to pay through the app, so I was disappointed. A month or so has gone by, and now my favorite  location takes payment through the app. This is the best because it’s integration with rewards makes it so I don’t have to stand outside swiping multiple cards/punching the keypad - it’s way faster and easier to do it all through the app.
title: Improved!

review: I finally decided to try this app yesterday, so I added my credit card and proceeded to the local station, which turned out to be closed for some reason. All of the sudden today I started getting fraudulent charges on my credit card. This may be completely coincidental, but I this app is the only thing I’ve done different recently, so I made the connection. If you use the app, keep an eye on your credit card account.
title: Possible Fraud Warning

review:
Fueling up at BP has always been a crapshoot due to the price disparity between cash and credit. I find its consistently cheaper to pump at a nearby station since I do not carry cash. However, I like the idea of BP gasoline and the driver rewards program was appealing to me. 

The app seems to work well, it’s BP that caused my issues. 
1. The labels on all the gas pumps were either faded or peeling, making it difficult to identify which pump I was using, which is necessary for app use. 
2. There is no price incentive for using the app. You still pay the credit price. I find this to be odd, but I suppose it’s intentional. 

For the second reason, I don’t think I’ll continue pumping at BP. I should be incentivized to use the app, but it’s still cheaper for me to hit the Mobile that is 2 buildings down and offers their gas at BP’s cash price- but for every user.
title: Cool idea, less than ideal execution

review:
Pro vs cons

Pros 
Keeps all your receipts
Easy payment system
You get rewards
You can see your nearest gas stations

Cons 
It’s the biggest one and makes the app 
Useless.

(Doesn’t save you any money.)
————————————————

Did the app work yes haven’t had a problem 
But the point of the app is so that your loyal customer that took there time to download your app save some money with the rewards and use your app.

This doesn’t happen and some simple math can show this.

Gas prices                                         Debt
Cash2.999  x 17 gallons = 50.983 < Dcard in app
Credit 3.099 x 17gallons = 52.683 <<App same Debit card

I paid more in the app $1.70 more if I used my card.    1.70-0.5=1.65 

The reward was 5cents for the 17gallons.

Until you guys don’t fix this it’s 1 Star and I won’t be using the app because there isn’t a point to at the moment until you fix the cash/credit on a debt card.
title: 1 stars and here’s why

review: This is a good app it could be better by adding posting gas prices so you can see the lowest price bp gas station in your area
title: Good app could be better

developerResponse: {'id': 8725715, 'body': 'Hi itsmeshal, sorry to hear you are having problems using the app. The rewards earned does fluctuate based on the amount you fuel. You\'ll get 10¢ off per gallon for every $100 spent on BP fuel.\nYou can remove your payment account in the app by finding the card on the "My Wallet" screen and tapping the "i" in the lower left corner of your card tile, then tapping "Remove".', 'modified': '2019-05-17T16:14:02Z'}
review: This app has a lot of potential but I think it should have been further developed and tested before being released. There’s no option for me to remove the card I have linked to the account and the reward amounts seem to fluctuate. After my first pump I had 4cents in rewards, second pump gave me 6cents but the 3rd pump brought it back down to 4cents. Rewarding is unclear and I’d honestly just rather delete the app but without an option to remove my card first it’s as if they’re locking you in. It’s also annoying to have to punch in the 4 digit pin every single time. The app already has my Touch ID linked so why do I still have to enter the pin? It’s annoying and not practical when you’re in a rush.
title: Annoyed

developerResponse: {'id': 11612317, 'body': 'Hi Bowhunter43 - BP and Amoco sites are independently owned and operated and set their own prices, including terms for different payment methods. When using the BPme app to purchase fuel, you will always be charged the stated credit card price. review: Love the app!!! It is about time that an app is created this quick an efficiently however, only thing I would love see change or added is that when pumping gas it doesn’t allow you to select the amount of money you would like to pay if you do not want to fill up and if the employee or yourself isn’t paying attention it will end up filling it up when maybe you meant to fill up $20 or so. Besides this I enjoy it very much and hope this gets added soon.
title: Love the savings

review:
Great app that has saved me money. Easy to use and no more worrying about scammer skimmers at the pump. I live in metro atlanta and crime at gas stations is at a all time high for cyber skimmer crime and regular robbery. Using this app is safe, quick, and eliminates having the wallet or credit card or debit card exposed. Quick and easy to use! Must have app for commuters! Thx BP!!
Willie Jones
title: Great app and saves me money

review: My wife and I truly love this app!  I especially like the fact that when she needs to fill up, she can enter info thru the app for payment and can keep her credit card safely in the vehicle. Thanks for developing this app, BP!!
title: Great App and Über Convenient

review:
I love the concept of being able to locate the nearest BP station and select/pay for a pump with my smart phone. Being able to apply rewards with app is quite easy as well! However, sometimes the app can be a little wonky when loading, and on a few rare occasions was not able to be used with compatible stations. I also have had fraud alerts block the use of the linked credit card on multiple occasions, but am not sure of that is more on the end of the fraud alert or the way the payment is secured by the app. 

Overall, the app is convenient and an easy way to apply rewards, but could use some fine tuning to make the experience completely seamless.
title: Great concept and rewards, but some minor flaws

developerResponse: {'id': 9095591, 'body': 'Tell your friends!  We think it’s pretty awesome too.', 'modified': '2019-06-10T14:46:36Z'}
review: I’ve been using the BP app for several months and love it. Why?  Three reasons. 1) Security. I’ve had my credit card skimmed more time than I can count and with this app NEVER have to even take my card out of my wallet. 2) convenience in managing my credit card receipts. I don’t have to worry about paper copies when I enter my charges in my accounting software...it’s all right there in the app. 3) Ease...I can find a BP near me, select and activate a pump without ever getting out of my car. developerResponse: {'id': 9095003, 'body': 'Thank you for taking time to leave feedback.  We are continually reviewing user suggestions and will evaluate them for future app releases.', 'modified': '2019-06-10T14:19:45Z'}
review: The app is intuitive enough to use once its setup.  The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because the start up of the app (once I’m at the BP station of my choice) takes noticeably longer to load than any of the other gas apps I use.  Maybe look at using async methods within the webservice application and have certain aspects of the app to load one at a time while the rest of the information (the cents off) loads.  When I first started using the app I thought it froze up since the UX just shows a gas station image for approx 15-20 seconds with no perceived activity by the app; maybe have a BP waiting/loading indicator.  Other than that I love the convenience of not having to use my BP rewards card and then use my credit card for a gas transaction.  Keep up the great work on the app; it’ll only get better!
title: Great overall

review: So, I too, had experienced a few glitches with the app when I first started using it. But since then, it’s worked pretty flawlessly. I can see my rewards balance right away, and be able to let them know whether or not to use it, or let it ride. Also it helps to tell you where the nearest BP pump is, especially when you’re somewhere you’re not familiar with. And lastly, it’s great not having to pull out my wallet! I gas up a lot in New Jersey, where you can’t pump your own gas. So I pull up to the pump, enter the info into the app. Tell the attendant how much, which grade, and whether to use the reward or not, and then tip and go! I also appreciate the extra rewards BP sends as well, keep up the good work BP!
title: Future Technology At The Pump!!!

review:
This app saved my day, I currently work 2 jobs so I don’t have time to waste with unnecessary trips. I went to get gas one day and realized I didn’t have my wallet. I did not have time to get home get my wallet, get gas, and get to work in time. I also did not have enough gas to make it to work!!!

Sitting at the pump having a moment where I was questioning every life decision that led me to this small but frustrating crisis, I noticed the sign to pay from your car with this app!!!

Within 2 minutes my “crisis” was solved. app downloaded, pay pal connected, done!

The app knew what station I was at all I needed to do was tell it what pump and the pump was authorizing.

Best part is I now get rewards for buying gas!!

developerResponse: {'id': 9095196, 'body': 'Unfortunately, the BPme app doesn’t accept debit as a form of payment quite yet. If you add a debit card into the app today it will process as credit. We are working to make enhancements to the app and this is one of them. Thank you for your feedback!', 'modified': '2019-06-10T14:26:56Z'}
review:
Overall, I love using this app because I don’t have to swipe a card at the pump and worry about checking for skimmers on the card reader. When I travel, I occasionally end up “losing” my reward because of paying the credit price at a station that charges different rates based on how you pay, which irritates me. 

The one problem I’ve had with the app itself is accidentally using the wrong card due to it defaulting to the last one you used. I don’t always use the same card, and it doesn’t prompt you to choose a card for the current transaction. I’ve done this twice, so I just try to be more mindful to check it. It would be better for me if it prompted you to select the card like it prompts you to select the pump number. Not sure if that’s an issue for anyone else.
title: Works really well

review: I like the app and the ability to receive rewards. However, I received a fraud alert message on the BPMe app 5 months AFTER I had been using it at one particular gas station in St. Louis. First of all, why on earth did it take soooo long to notify me of a “potential” fraud? Secondly, after customer support “fixed” the issue and updated my home address and with my bank, I relocated to a different state. I was still receiving the fraud alert message forcing me to manually use my debit card, thus not being able to take advantage of the rewards program. I’m STILL not able to use my debit card, I’ve had to link my PayPal account to the app in order to use it. Very frustrating! 🤦🏾‍♀️

review: Overall like the design, process, and capabilities.   Beware that if you don’t use the BP card, the app submits the transaction to your card company as a manual transaction that for me at least is frequently blocked as fraud.  The process fails but does not tell you why. I figure it out when I get the fraud card services calling me.   This occurs with one card at least 30 percent of the time which is causing me to not make the effort to seek out a BP station.  Please BP, update the technology to leverage Apple/Android pay  I think it would be a cheaper transaction than manual as well.
title: Concept good

developerResponse: {'id': 9806809, 'body': "Hi FndrStrat06- We're sorry you're having issues with your password reset. Thanks for letting us know, the team will have a look.  If you wish to speak with someone, give us a call 1-877-852-3025.  Any additional information we can get about the problem will be helpful!  Thanks, FD", 'modified': '2019-07-23T13:16:11Z'}
review:
If you forget your password, like I did, you will be redirected to mybpstation.com to change your password. If you go through the process and update your password through the web site, you then have to update it again to use the app. This is because BP sends a dummy password for you to log in with, and then change it. The site recognizes these changes, but the app still wants the dummy password to log in with, even though the dummy password is now invalid because you’ve changed it to a password of your liking. So in order to use the app and, you know, use the rewards program, you’ll have to do this process at least twice.

All that being said, the app does what it says it does. It gives me discounts on gas and rewards loyalty. Until I forget my password, that is.
title: Pray You Don’t Forget Your Password

developerResponse: {'id': 10617354, 'body': 'Hi ZetaBleu, thank you for taking the time to provide such a thorough review. We sincerely apologize for your experience with the BPme app and lack of communication regarding your first call. We would love to have the opportunity to rectify this situation but need your email address in order to investigate and action your open ticket. Can you please contact us at 1-877-852-3025 or https://www.mybpstation.com/contact-us? Again, we apologize for this inconvenience and look forward to hearing from you. Thank you, the BPme Team', 'modified': '2019-09-10T19:34:27Z'}
review:
This app was wonderful when it first rolled out. I downloaded and used it immediately. About a month ago it stopped working telling me my payment option didn’t work. This occurred for every debit card on my account. Called the banks thinking they were blocking the transaction and it turns out nothing they don’t see a transaction attempt on their end. This happened in 2 states during travel where I have previously used the app without issue. One instance it magically worked after multiple attempts then didn’t work the following day at the exact same station.

I called customer service who took all of my information including multiple dates when it didn’t work and the last 4 digits of my card. Was told I would hear from someone in several business days. That was almost 3 weeks ago. Called yesterday and was told my ticket was still open... hmmm, no follow-up call or correspondence? So my first call did nothing now my second call is “documented”. 

Well, you made it easy to switch to Shell. As a loyal BP customer, having to now go into the station every time to enter my number for rewards (because the card I’ve had for years no longer works since the app roll out) completely defeats the reason why I was using the app. The customer service representative’s response to my follow-up call was unacceptable. I have to just wait and never receive communication as to the status or if/when the issue is resolved? No thank you. Now I am no longer a loyal BP customer. Shell is my new place for gas. BP doesn’t care anyway. I am just one of many.
title: Worked, now not working, ZERO response from BP

review:
Was really pumped (pun intended) for the new rewards program. I have to admit I was a little nervous about what changes they’d make but the perpetual $0.05 off/gallon is awesome. I’ll end up with more savings compared to the old program. Right on!

I was totally surprised (in a good way) by the new app too. They really nailed every part of it. Even the new icon looks great on my home screen. 

Love how everything has been redesigned and it looks very modern and clean. Set up was super smooth and it’s very easy to navigate and use. No problems updating settings, adding payment, checking rewards and history etc.
title: New BP app and rewards! Home run!

developerResponse: {'id': 11107755, 'body': 'Hi TV in ChicagoLand, Thank you for taking time to leave feedback. We are continually reviewing user suggestions and will evaluate them for future app releases. Thanks, the BPme Team', 'modified': '2019-10-07T19:18:05Z'}
review:
I have been using the BP rewards program using their card, for years now. I fill up weekly due to my long commute and I averaged about $40 per fill up. 
BP discontinued the card program forcing us to use the BPme app instead. Well I used the app and I am not a fan for many reasons:
1. It takes a lot longer to start the transaction. You have to connect to the station’s Wi-Fi and select the pump you’re on. Some stations connections are very slow. This takes a lot longer compared to swiping the card. Not good in my book especially if you’re in a rush
2. I used BPme in 2 different stations. Both of them charged me a $1 “convenience” fee!  This of course negates the gas savings by using the rewards system

Needless to say BP has lost me as a client. I don’t understand why they could not keep both the card and app rewards system as many of their competitors are doing
title: BPme instead of the Rewards Card - bad choice by BP

review: BP has redesigned the rewards program and named it BPme, so I downloaded the new version of the app and tried to register a new account. But after I clicked the verify link in the email, and set the password, the webpage said that I have no access to any app! I went back to the app and tried to log in anyways, it didn’t say anything wrong after about 10 seconds of “logging in” procedure but just brought me back to the loggin/register page. I tried closing the app and open again, it repeated what has happened. If I put a wrong password, it rejects me immediately, which means that it did recognize my credentials when I put in the right password. Obviously, the app has some bug. I called the 800 number at 6:05 pm EDT on Monday 10/3/19, which is 4:05 CST, but what I heard is: “We are currently closed; our business hours are Mon-Fri, 6 am-7 pm CST.” Yes, I called again to make sure that I heard it right. That means I called during the so-called business hours but they were closed. I feel BP just doesn’t want my business.
title: Doesn’t work! Doesn’t do business!

review:
1) I wasn’t getting the emailed codes to my inbox. They all went to my junk folder. So, look there for them. It was frustrating the crap outta me! 
2) Once I entered the code, the app walked me through the remaining steps to set up (& verify) my account w/ my BP Rewards card. 
3) BP is offering a .15cents per gallon promo for signing up. At least that’s what it says. It’s .05cents per gallon after $100.00 spent every month. 
4) Looking forward to using the app later tonight.
title: App works perfectly & looks great!

developerResponse: {'id': 11107639, 'body': "Hi DailyFox, thanks for your review. We are aware of an issue that is impacting some users and are working hard to rectify this. We will update you here when this is resolved. To locate the BP nearest to you that offers BPme – simply go to the “Find a Station” screen in the app.  You can also look here: filter on 'BPme Accepted' https://www.mybpstation.com/station-finder. Thanks, the BPme Team", 'modified': '2019-10-07T19:08:44Z'}
review:
This is useless and false advertising! The station locator shows that all gas stations works with the app.

 Stopped at the gas station i usually go to, opened app, selected pump and have verification to use the pump.....but the pump is not activated.  Tried a second time - same thing. I drove to the next pump, same thing. After I went to the third pump, I walked inside the store just to find out - “THE APP DOES NOT WORK HERE BUT YOU CAN STILL SWIPE YOUR CARD THAT YOU SETUP YOUR ACCOUNT WITH AND IT WILL RECOGNIZE YOUR REWARDS” 

Well guess what , when you use a virtual number from CAPITAL ONE (for obvious online security reasons), the pump wont recognize your card , therefore my $47 purchase was in vain. Why roll this program out ... if it is this useless?!! And why do false advertising stating that the app works there .... when it really does not activate the pump for usage AT ALL!!?? Absolutely false advertising and poorly planned and rolled out. I see the potential but this is very frustrating !!

How can we find out which gas stations REALLY work using this app and not just pretend they do?
title: Does not work

Here is an update to my app experience. The app did work, although it loads very slow. The app identifies gas stations that either don’t participate or their system isn’t working with the app. I went to a station today and the attendant said the app doesn’t work there. He didn’t know why. The app sent me to this station and the station was advertising the new BPme app

I left and went to Exxon whose app works and I gained rewards points with them

I was a loyal BP Rewards member. Yesterday I went to use the new app I was at the pump, the map showed me at the station and yet it couldn’t find a station (yes the app states that the station I was at participated with BPme. I then used my credit card that I linked to my account. Guess what I don’t have credit for my purchase

All the gas stations by me are the same price. It’s time to join someone else’s rewards program, unless this app is fixed by the time I need gas again (later this week)

review: I downloaded the app right as the rewards quit. I used the normal rewards every week with my job causing me to travel a lot. Now I go to use this new app and get it all set up. I went to a local bp station and went to log in. I had no issues logging in. Once I logged in and proceeded to pay it told me I wasn’t at a bp station. The bp station was 100 yards down the road. So I got out and paid for the gas. Thru the reader and didn’t get a discount. Then out of curiosity I went down the road to the “gas station” location and found it to be a rev park with no gas station. The gas station was put in the system in the wrong area. So now it wants me to pay for my gas down the road from the gas station pick a pump and hope it’s open. Or let someone steal my gas. My company request we use Exxon since we get a discount with them but with the rewards I could get one with bp but now the gas card that I use doesn’t have 16 digits and it won’t let me load it I have to go to Exxon. I also know this has effected others in our company as well. Also I would get over 5 cent off every fill up when it was rewards but now I can only get 5 percent off. Go back to the old way it was more efficient and convenient.

review:
**Oct. 21st update**

After I called customer service and they put in a ticket; I saw there was an update for the app. Everything worked smoothly there after. Haven’t used it yet. Oh well, just be glad that it is working like it should now. 

**Oct. 7th update**

So I hear back from them to say they have looked into and it should be fixed. Well I go to the app and it’s says it’s going to send me a code in an email. Got that, entered it and everything seems good. Well I was fooled because it took me right back to the security verification with the 4 digit code. An once again it wasn’t excepting any of the codes. 🙄 I’m over this whole thing at this point.

*Original*

I loved the app before the update. After the update it makes you re-register and then when I go to long in is where it goes south. It sends me a 4 digit code to verify and it doesn’t except it. Like what is really going on.  I have an email to the app company like 3 days ago and I still haven’t heard back. They should of just updated the app with out same reward info. That would of made it a lot easier or just release the update when it was fully function-able.

review: Our local BP station is pretty basic. I use it because I want gas with a better detergent than the Raceway gas. I’d used the previous BP rewards program and it never worked as the stations didn’t recognize my Amex card and as I don’t intend to carry around a separate reward card I only used it for my ‘play’ car which only gets gas once a month. However this app works really well recognizing the station and the pump right away. It unlocked the pump and processed the payment accurately and fast then sent an email receipt. I think I’ll be using it for all our gas locally. Going on a couple of road trips soon so will see if it continues to impress. Fingers crossed!
title: I was skeptical, but it works well.

review:
While the idea of an app seems great, this one is certainly not.  It does not work half the time and takes twice and long as the old way.  I went to my local bp in NJ today to get gas.  I pulled up then I have to get my cell phone out, then I have to go to the app, then I have to login or do my face id, then I have to select the pump, pick payment method and wait for the pump to connect to the app.  Three times I tried and each time it said your bank had denied it.  I was talking to the guy there who pumps the gas, he said 5 people there right now also cannot use the app.  The old way was so much better and easier.  You go online you attach a credit card to the account and the pump would ask do you want to use your points.  This takes 3 times as long and makes lines at the station.  I cannot understand how anyone could think this was anyway easier or better.  Bring back the old way as this way is terrible.

Update.   This is the bp on mount pleasant ave in Livingston nj 07039.   While you can fix the location to make the app actually work what can you do to make it faster to use.  Like I said this Thames 3 times longer to use.
title: Horrible

developerResponse: {'id': 11578920, 'body': "Hi Digitalpentad - We're sorry to hear about your experience. In certain instances, individual pumps may not be available for use with BPme. Where possible, please move to a different pump and try again. If you have a payment card linked through the BPme app to your BPme Rewards account, you may use that card for payment at the pump and qualify for BPme Rewards on the fuel purchase. Additionally, the app needs at least 3G signal to work or needs to be connected to WiFi. If you don't have a strong enough signal at a site, please fill up and pay at the pump or in the store. You can also use a linked payment card from your BPme app to qualify for BPme Rewards on the fuel purchase. For additional support, you can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further. Thank you, BPme Team\n\n", 'modified': '2019-10-31T13:23:07Z'}

review:
Update: after a fifth attempt to reach someone at the 800 number, I finally got through. Someone answered surprisingly quickly. The solution for this was that they had to delete the account from their side, I then reinstalled the app and registered a new account. My promotional rewards were not lost doing this. Everything seems to be working now.

Original review/issue: I’ve been trying to use this app since the beginning of October, but it doesn’t work. Every time I choose to log in to my account, it simply goes back to the same page where you can choose login or create account again.

I’ve called BP’s support number 4 times and waited on hold for over 45 minutes each time, never reaching an actual human being. The automated message on the support line has continued to say that they’re aware of an issue for weeks. I don’t know how an obscure gas app could possibly have such long hold times or take this long to fix.
title: [Update: support can fix] The app simply doesn’t work, no support

review:
They won’t even accept their own BP fleet cards? Unacceptable since linking a card is now a requirement. The previous rewards system was much better as it could be used independent of a linked credit card. This one is virtually unusable for me now unless I’m driving my wife’s car, since my day to day vehicle is a company car. At the very least the app should allow one to choose to pay at the pump so the customer can swipe whatever card they want (like a fleet card) or even pay cash if they want. 

The previous reward program often had me willing to go out of my way a little to fill up at a BP (probably 3 out of 4 times). This new rewards has made me not care at all if I go to a BP or not. Maybe it’s time to switch to another fleet card that offers rewards for using theirs at their stations? I’ll wait a couple more months to see if BP gets their act together and stops penalizing fleet card users or people who prefer to pay with cash.
title: BP Fleet Cards and Cash Not Accepted

review:
1) Life is already much too complicated and overly tech dependent. My card was simple and 100% effective. I would be okay with having an app as an option along with card use for those that wished to. 
2) Apparently you’re either not aware that not every person who needs to buy gas has a smartphone, knows how to use a smart phone, or has unlimited and universally accessible WiFi or you just don’t care about people who can’t use or afford them. To keep my phone bill as low as possible, I have a “pay as you go plan” and often can’t use apps when I don’t have a WiFi connection. This is an absolutely classist system for providing a “benefit” to your customers. You seem to want us to be more loyal to you than you’re willing to be to us.

developerResponse: {'id': 12168453, 'body': 'Thanks for taking the time to leave a review! We appreciate your feedback. - BPme Support Team', 'modified': '2019-12-02T21:32:43Z'}
review: Overall, this app is working well.  You can set up multiple payment types (credit cards, debit cards, PayPal, etc), which provides flexibility.  Paying for gas is a simple wizard process to select the pump, payment type, the purchase, all while sitting in your car.  For cold or inclement weather, this avoid the hassle of standing at the pump to go through the credit card process, or even running inside to pay.  Similarly, this provides for a further level of safety in that you can leave your credit/debit cards in the card, and focus on pumping the gas.
title: Great App for Cold Weather and Safety!

review:
Definitely sub-par from the old plastic card you had in your wallet.  Not that the card has any special powers but you had the choice of using your “cents off” or not and letting them cumulate.  Now, if you earned a .20 of promo but only needed to fill the lawnmowers gas can you are forced to use it.  

I haven’t shut off the texted alerts yet, but I have shut off their notification.  The alerts are nothing more than reminders that BP exists.  Sort of like having kids in the back seat constantly asking “Are we there yet?”   After a short while it just gets annoying.
title: Much Ado About Nothing

review: The whole process is convoluted. First the amount of security in this app, exceeds my banking app. A 10 character password followed by MFA via text and then a pin. Simply ridiculous. Then, I have to sit in my car and hope I have good signal in order to start fueling. That took almost 2 minutes just me sitting in my car waiting for the app. There are some things that aren’t optimized by using a phone and paying for gas is one of them. Do you know how easy Shell makes it? All you do is swipe your credit card and boom the rewards are there. I only downloaded this app because Amex had a discount promo. I will be deleting it and use Shell exclusively from now on - it is so much easier to use.
title: Absolutely horrible

review:
Used the app successfully the first time to purchase fuel.  Went later the same day to a different station to fill up a different car.  Was unable to log in to the app.  Entered email and password, just get a blank screen and will not log in.  Also no option to use Face ID, even though I have it enabled and successfully used it at my fill up earlier in the day.  

So I gave up and just used the pump card reader with credit card to purchase fuel.  No discount of course.  Also this pump would not print a receipt...needed to go inside which I did not have time to do. 

Overall this seems like a waste of time.  I’m not going to go out of my way to visit a BP station for a discount, when I’m not sure if I’ll be able to log into the app when I get there.  

Will be deleting.
title: Difficulty logging in

If someone reaches out to me and get my Rewards active on account & app. Till the , I’m frustrated & done, will but be Fueling & Purchasing elsewhere until Someone contacts me & fixes this issue. review: I’d rate this app zero stars if I could. Why won’t the app link my BP Visa card? As I enter the account number, the space where I could enter the expiration date disappears and goes to the space where I would add the 3 digit security code. A pop up says my card can’t be linked and to call the number in the pop up. Scanning the card was also a failure. I called the phone number that was given. The customer service reps at that number speak very poor English; the only thing I understood was that they would text me a security code that would allow me to link my card. They did and the code didn’t work, it kept saying the code was invalid. I was able to request a new code which was sent but it was also invalid. And no, it wasn’t operator error, the codes were entered correctly. I gave up using the BPme app and will just swipe my BP Visa card at the pump to get the rewards. So please quit texting/emailing me to link my BP Visa card when your app doesn’t allow it!
title: Can’t link BP Visa card

I stopped carrying my bp card because the app had been working. Now it won’t even connect over WiFi. Been a loyal BP customer for years but this is absurd. Very disappointed and very glad I stopped for fuel AFTER work and not before!!!

review: Why did BP get rid of the physical card? I really wish someone would actually think this through.The first few times the app conveniently lost my log in so I had to change my password. Now I’m always getting an error that my card was declined. Mind you, I have used this on the day I got paid so I clearly had more then enough money in my account. So there are bank connection issues as well. Either that or Chase bank is smart and doesn’t want to work with the app. Great concept but overall they need to bring back the physical card they had before. I spend more time at the pump trying to get the app to work then I do when I just swipe my card. And trying to submit anything through customer service is a joke. I understand it takes a few days to get responses but the one time I did, the person responding didn’t even answer half of my issues. So cool. I only put BP gas in my car but I doubt I will ever use this terrible app again.

review: I was excited for the new app. It took me almost 30 mins to get it to set up my payment card. It ended up being a security issue with my card but there was no way from the BP end to contact anyone at the time to do it. And no way to get the discounted price without the payment set up. Another bigger issue is that on Speedway, we can see the current prices at any station anywhere on their locator. I cannot find anywhere in the BP app where it shows the CURRENT GAS PRICES, not even on the STATION LOCATOR page. I also cannot make a list of Favorite Stations near me or the ones I would use when traveling multiple times a month between home & Wauwatosa or Indianapolis to take my son to college & visit my Grandbabies. I normally plan my trips to land my fill-ups based on current prices. If I can’t find the prices at BP stations, I will just keep my gas stops at Speedway.
title: Why aren’t Current Gas Prices listed??

developerResponse: {'id': 12692609, 'body': 'Thank you for providing feedback on BPme Rewards. We very much value your business and hope to keep you as a loyal consumer. We are sorry that you are unhappy with the new BPme Rewards program. We take your feedback seriously and will continue to look for ways to improve the experience for our best consumers.', 'modified': '2020-01-02T18:51:21Z'}
review: Ridiculous. Can’t add credit card. Had added one previously and worked, now trying to add another it keeps going into “Problem adding card” loop. Tried multiple cards. Erased and redownloaded app, erased previous card etc to no avail. Also login is a pain and requires too many steps repeatedly. The imei from the phone and pin you chose should be enough. Just wasted 30 minutes at the pump and also met a family member there because the app was too complicated for them to use. All because we wanted to use the Amex offer we had for this “app”.  Unlinked all cards, deleted app, and went to a Shell station instead. Will avoid BP stations in the future due to the loss of time and aggravation this caused. 70 years ago, mankind was flying into outer space. Now, in 2020, this is the best technology has to offer? Especially from a multi billion dollar company who has every resource to make a simple app correctly? Pathetic. Hey clowns, instead of bloating apps and services with spyware, tracking, and data mining, how about you first make a functional product and solid UI. Then steal peoples data. BP is a joke. Tired of these giant companies bloating technology and releasing crap into the market. You’ll also notice these issues have been ongoing and this app is littered with 1-star reviews, yet the App Store shows a 5-star rating. Always read reviews sorted by “most recent first”. That way you can see the real reviews before the Tech-world deletes them or covers them up. Entities should be held accountable for all this EPIDEMIC manipulation. Now will probably get a canned reply from the developer saying,” Looks like a technical issue, call this number.” No thanks, not going to fall for your fake sincerity and concern and waste even more time calling even more clueless “customer service” reps. If your company is so concerned, send out some gift cards for wasting everybody's time, or at least some form of genuine accountability. But as long as the executives Limo’s stay waxed, guess all of us sheep should be happy with our 5 cent “discounts.” Hey BP, you know where you can shove that gas nozzle. Enjoy your profits, gas-holes.
title: Can’t add credit card, useless time waster

developerResponse: {'id': 12692617, 'body': 'Thank you for providing feedback on BPme Rewards. We very much value your business and hope to keep you as a loyal consumer. We take your feedback seriously and will continue to look for ways to improve the experience for our best consumers.', 'modified': '2020-01-02T18:52:02Z'}
review:
The card won’t scan so I entered it manually 
At first I entered the number incorrectly and got an error message.  The only way to enter it again was to close the app and try again. Correcting the number did not let me tap the green bar. It was still gray. 
I got the card entered finally. Then I had to verify the card 
I got the text message from Synchrony and entered the code. After doing it CORRECTLY 3 times I had to request another code. After entering that one CORRECTLY 3 times I was locked out for entering the WRONG code. 
I even tried tapping the message so it was automatically entered by my phone 
Now I have to wait 24 hours to probably get locked out again. 
Not a good introduction to the app
title: Cannot add my BP card

review:
In general, the app works well, the individual location participation makes it sad. The premise I was led to believe was that, if I linked my BP gas card to the app, discounts would be treated as they are at the pump, BP cards are treated as cash sales, thus the discount would be off of cash prices. This is true in some stations, but not all! My most recent purchase was using a 10¢ discount, but the discount was taken off of the credit price, so, the actual discount compared to the cash price was a whopping 2¢!
Corporate needs to get all of its franchise players on the same page, to make the usefulness of the app more appealing.
title: Individual results may vary

review: I liked the app & using it is very easy. The downfall of this app is that it takes extra money off the card to secure a payment. The funds eventually appeared back on the card but I wasn’t able to use the card because the same thing would happen again. So instead...I should have just used cash from the very beginning. developerResponse: {'id': 13297049, 'body': 'Thank you for reaching out to us about this issue. The problem you encountered at your station appears to be a temporary card hold issued by your financial institution. We would appreciate it if you could please contact your bank or credit card company directly and speak with one of their agents in regards to this matter. They would be able to provide you with feedback on when the hold will approximately come off according to their records. BP does not have access to place holds on any credit card or personal bank accounts, and cannot be responsible for any overdraft fees that may occur.\n \nHowever, if this transaction was processed as an unauthorized charge, you must have your bank or credit card company dispute the charges by initiating a charge-back. I will have to say it does have a couple negatives.

So yeah it’s sort of an inconvenience more than anything but would be nice to have the feature. Second is that your beware only last a month and I feel pressured just to good to bq gas station only. review:
This app was such a pain to get set up that I ended up giving up and decided to just stick with shell for buying my gas. After the email verification step you are supposed to create a password but the link went to a normal login screen for me the first two times. The third time trying this process I was able to land on the password creation screen, and upon submitting I was brought to a “change your password” screen. What? I just created it. I exited and tried logging in now that I had set my password— no luck. I did the password reset option, and clicked the link in the email. This apparently generates a second email that sends a verification code— but the way the gmail app opens links, you can not open that second email while you are in the screen you navigates to from clicking the link in the first email. So i had to close out of the screen asking for the verification code to check the new email, and then went back to the first link and now it didn’t take the code. 
I just flew through setting up Sunoco, shell, and Exxon mobile apps right before this, and decided it’s not worth the trouble and will be deleting this app.
title: Ridiculously buggy to get set up initially

Thanks, BPme Team", 'modified': '2020-03-25T20:31:31Z'}
review:
Today, March 23, 2020

There was a problem when I used the app today in Rosemount, MN. I suspect that the pump I was using did not reset completely after the previous transaction.  When I received a message on the app that the pump was ready, it didn’t work. I tried to run the app a 2nd time from my phone, and it never connected. Lastly, I closed the app on my phone and turned my phone completely off.  I then went to the pump and pushed the cancel button and waited for the pump to reset. Next, I powered up my phone and was able to use the app successfully, but that is a lot of monkey-business to use this app. I would have left my feedback related to this transaction from the app itself, but it timed out; so I am leaving feedback/ a review here (typed quickly on my phone) because it is the best that I could accomplish.
title: It does not always work.

developerResponse: {'id': 14942175, 'body': "Hi ScottyDR, we're sorry to hear about your experience. For security purposes, after you enter your credit card into the app, your personal and card details are never stored directly on your phone, in the event that your phone is ever lost or stolen, your card information would not be accessible from the app. The app also requires additional security features such as a passcode and security questions to prevent others from accessing your app and using your phone to pay for fuel. If you have additional questions, please contact us at 800-333-3991. Thanks, BPme ", 'modified': '2020-04-27T13:15:45Z'}
review: I was excited to see this app especially for the convenience of not having to insert my card at the pump because of hackers putting skimmers in the card slots in the gas pumps. But I did even make it to a station before my card was hacked after entering my information into the app. I called my bank and had the card shut off before I was stolen blind! I still get text alerts that they are still trying to use my card, thankfully I have it shut down so it declines their attempted transactions. I do not trust BP’s security of my card information!
title: Do not trust this service

review:
Very nice using this app

title: Contractor

review: It’s an okay app! Took me forever set up, and when i finally got things working I was still very confused on how it worked! Love the concept of not having to so hand to hand  payment, especially during this time, but I don’t like that you can not choose your gas amount! I live in a state where gas stations are full service so my gas is pumped for me! The attendants will often walk away to help other customers, so if you’re not paying attention you could end up  with a full tank when all you wanted was 20 worth of gas!!!!!!  I will only be using the app when I  know I’m going to fill up!! If I can’t punch in the amount I want, it’s useless!
title: Decent App

review: If you want to cut down on contact with the pump, this couldn’t be easier. Use the app to select the pump and pay. The only other thing you need to do is put the nozzle in the tank and select the grade. Fast and easy.

review:
Overall, I love being able to use the app on my phone instead of at the pump, especially when the weather is bad.

One enhancement would be the ability to add favorites. I almost always get gas from the same station. It’s annoying to have it have to find my station when it’s almost always the same.

Also, some kind of BPfamily would be nice. My husband and I always have rewards but because of my daughters car and miles driven, she doesn’t. Some way to earn and redeem rewards as a family but still have individual access/accounts would be great!

review:
I love the convenience of the app. We almost exclusively use BP for fuel so it’s so easy to fill up. Here are some negatives
We have had issue with two accounts using the same credit card. We tried using the same account (3 drivers) but that hasn’t really worked well either. The other big issue are gift cards. We purchase BP cards often and receive them as gifts. There should be a way to add gift cards to the app so I can still get credit for fueling at BP but also usie my gift cards. Think Starbucks, Chick fil a, Amazon, Target....all apps let you add gift cards AND credit card/payment info so everything is stored in one place. Until that is resolved the app is not great, but pretty good.
title: Almost great

developerResponse: {'id': 16075733, 'body': 'Hi Brionté, thanks for your updated review. The ALT only works at participating BPme sites. Thanks, BPme Team', 'modified': '2020-06-18T14:32:02Z'}
review:
At BP I used to be able to enter my number or swipe my loyalty card at the pump. I cannot do that any longer. Why? I have to download this app and use it to pay. Or use it to link my cards so that the discount applied automatically. The latter wasn’t clear until I tried paying at the pump a second time (worked fine only once, a problem that BP acknowledges is common but apparently won’t fix). After calling my banks, I tried removing all my cards and adding them back but could not add anything back; kept getting an error message. So I called customer service which says it flagged my account for fraud but cannot explain why. That’s why I can’t make payments in the app. The rep informed me that I should just pay at the pump (then why have an app?!?!), and as long as my cards are linked to my loyalty account the discounts will apply. But of course, now I can’t add any of my cards. The app just says there is an error. Over and over again. I am over it. Why over complicate things with unnecessary tech?

Edit: The ALT ID option is missing from most pumps. I used to be able to press cancel and get it to come up but at least in my area, since the program changed, it doesn’t work anymore.
title: Why complicate things?

11/6 update just cam through. Still can’t login with the same problem. What a pile of junk. 

10/27 Update: The app has just gone from bad to worse. I can now sign in, but that is about as far as I can go. 

I login with my email and password. It then asks me to create a security question which I do. Then it asks me to enter a 4 digit security code. It then tells me that my email is already used to create an account. 

I AM NOT trying to create an account. I am just trying to login as I have always done. 

God awful app
———————//

With each update the BP app gets worse. With this last large update the app tries to do a security check by sending you a 4 digit code. I received the code, entered it, and it tells me it is the wrong code. 

I tried 5 times already. 

If it doesn’t work by this weekend I am dumping it. Not worth the trouble.

UPDATE 06/28/20. I spoke to all sorts of levels of support and they have been, at best, unhelpful and unsupportive. Time to bag the app as useless.

developerResponse: {'id': 16986384, 'body': "Hi TDS1984, thanks for reaching out to us about this. Face ID for login was disabled after the app updated to version 4.8.4. We're sorry to hear you're having trouble getting your card added to the account as well as other technical issues. Our support team will do their best to assist you and can be reached at 800-333-3991 Monday- Friday 6am-7pm CST. Thanks! BPme Team", 'modified': '2020-07-30T17:53:29Z'}
review:
Because I have not been able to get my app to work for over a month. Every time I have some spare time to call for help they are closed. I am so disappointed! This WAS an awesome app especially with COVID19 and not wanting to touch the terminal. It worked awesome. Then one day I pulled up for gas and they app wouldn’t open. When I tried to log in it said I was entering invalid credentials. Umm no. I have Face ID. Pretty sure my face hasn’t changed! Thank God I also carry my BP card and was still able to pay and get my rewards. 

Today I was finally able to change my password and get into the app but my BP credit card info that WAS in my app is now gone. When I try to put it back in I get an error message that’s says “something went wrong. Please call us, retry or log out” so I logged back out and when I tried to log back in it tells me my credentials are wrong again. So I go to the bp website to log into my rewards account to see if I can find something there...let me log right in (with the credentials the app says is wrong??) BUT it’s asking me if I want to be alerted via email or text or both. No matter what I click on it tells me “an error has occurred” even though I’m logged in online I can’t get past this screen to even see my rewards account. 

Come on BP. You were doing so great. Hire some better IT folks and get this issue fixed. Based off all the other recent reviews it’s clear that this is an ongoing issue and you know about it but have not fixed it. You can do better then that. I know you can.
title: Thank God I carry my BP card

Then I figured I was totally wrong. At the pump, I tried to add my Amex card more than 20 times, every time it will say “there’s something wrong” so the card cannot be added for payment. review:
PREVIOUS REVIEW - Something has gone terribly wrong!

I’ve been using the BP app for a couple of years and I loved it!

In the past 2 to 3 weeks every time I go to open the app it cannot find me or my account for several minutes to 10 minutes.

It sits and thinks and thinks and thinks, and then all of a sudden my info pops up.

Who wants to sit at the gas pump for 10 minutes waiting for your app to load?

Again, this app was phenomenal. I used it all the time and loved it.

Hey, BP me, fix the issue or I’m going to use my gasbuddy app.

It’s a lot of work for five cents!The convenience is gone!

I’ve logged in online and check my account and everything is fine. I deleted the app and reinstalled. Same issues leg times are about 10 minutes to load my payment my history find a station etc. etc.
title: Fixed! Thanks BP!

review:
The app is great, always picks up the correct station and unlocks the gas pump. The only issue is, paying is always credit, even when using PayPal as a payment. The BP Stations always charge 10 cents per gallon when using the app. There is no way around it, so I end up paying 5 cents more a gallon since the discount is only 5 cents. I am not sure why BP has the app, if they have a 10 cent discount, then it would be great, at least this way I am paying what a cash paying customer is paying and not 5 cents more. 

Another gas company allows you to pay the same amount as cash by using their app. I use PayPal to pay. It’s not PayPal credit, it is the money I have in my account with PayPal.
title: The app is great but no discount

review: If you like an application that only works about 50% of the time you will love this app.  Each time I go to fill my tank with gas I’m filled with anticipation just wondering if it will work or not.  Half the time the app either doesn’t load or it gives you a pump activation error.  However, when it does display the pump activation error it is nice enough to recommend swiping your BP card.....which defeats the purpose of the app.  When it does work it works great.  Unfortunately, half the time I just leave the station frustrated.

review:
Although the app used GPS to identify and direct me to nearby station (11120 US 23 Hwy, Mars Hill, NC), which is designated as “BPme payment enabled,” when I arrived on August 29th, 2020, and selected “Pay for Fuel,” the app could not sense that I was at the station. I had both WiFi and Bluetooth enabled. Going to the Station Finder did not help. Again, the app used GPS to show me nearby stations, but didn’t allow me to select or identify the station at which I was sitting. Disappointing experience for my first use.

Later in the day, I attempted to use the app at a BP station at 7111 Sudley Rd, Manassas, VA. This station is also designated as “BPme payment enabled.”  And, although the app recognized that I was at the station, it told me that something was wrong with the payment system.  So I could not pay for the purchase using the app. I was, however, able to receive the price adjustment by paying with a credit card that I had associated with the app. But I had to insert the credit card into the credit card reader, and the rewards points did it immediately show-up. This frustrated me because the purchase presumably will not qualify for an additional promotion offered by my credit card issuer (American Express) for purchases made using the app.
title: Can’t Sense When I’m at a Station

review: Sometimes this and sometimes not. While at the service station pump, it detects the specific service station correctly. review: BP is not the least expensive place to get gas. However I have had a BP card for years and recently I downloaded the app on my phone. I get $.10 discount per gallon just because I have the credit card, and another five cents as long as I spend $100 a month, which is not hard at all. I have quite a few fuel apps downloaded and some are used regularly. However I do use the BP app more because even though BPs fuel prices are a little bit higher usually than others, with the $.15 discount the price usually beats everyone else. And I also know that I’m getting a little bit better fuel that I may be getting at the local corner Joe’s gas station.

review: I recently emailed BP about why I’m paying credit card prices at the pump even though I have my debit card on file. The pump says debit same as cash. They responded and said it will be a credit card purchase. That’s a sham to people using the app if they have a debit card on file and expecting the cash price. I hope others are paying attention to the pump price. There’s a big difference in prices between the two. I won’t be using the app anymore, I will just swipe my card to save a lot more money. I’m only giving 3 stars, I like the app function but poor options on allowing a debit card use to get the cash price.

developerResponse: {'id': 18949039, 'body': "Hi ATL reader, we understand your frustration and appreciate you taking the time to update your review. We assure you that we do read each review and consider the feedback for app development. If you'd like a follow up from our support team, please contact them at 800-333-3991 or bpconsumer@bp.com with screen shots and your contact information. Unfortunately, we do not have your contact information here, nor do we ask for it as it would be visible to the public and we value protecting your privacy. Our support team can ensure that your feedback reaches our developers and that you receive a follow up on this issue.Thanks, BPme Team ", 'modified': '2020-11-06T19:38:32Z'}
review:
Today I attempted to set up and use the BPme app. As a BP shareholder I thought I should be supportive of the ad marketing money spent with AmEX to get me to try their app through the Amex Offers.

The App looks like it might be nice; however I could not get into the app because of the very light font on a white background. For this of us with vision issues, color clubs was, etc., this app is a waste of time. 

Someone in BPs design department must have thought this was a clever idea to make the app look “modern”. In fact, this “cleverness” just cost the company a new customer, wasted marketing money and made me seriously consider selling my BP stock if this is the kind of cutting edge “wisdom” guiding their fight to remain relevant. Did anyone review this with any test group of users?!?! 

I called the 800 support to register my issue and was told - I could just link my card to the app. I don’t have a card. I was going to be a new addition, a new customer, using a promotion that BP spent money on to capture me. That was all wasted. Brilliant thinking BP! Thank your app developers for losing this potential customer before I was even able to get in the door. 

I gave this a 1 star because 0 was not an option. 

————-
November 4, 2020

Developers finally responded but with a non-answer and no clarification of any possible app developments to remedy the actual light character on light background issue. No reaching out for screenshots or clarification, Nothing but a lame  we are sorry use your card. Which means - they didn’t even read the review. As a shareholder I am furious that this group of developers is still mucking up the experience and that they have the nerve to respond to a shareholder without even reading the review. Clearly they just have to respond but not with anything meaningful or relevant. Disgraceful.
title: Horrible horrible horrible

title: Just doesn’t work

developerResponse: {'id': 12216945, 'body': "We're sorry to hear of your experience. We'd love to look into this for you. Please contact our help desk by calling 1-800-333-3991 M-F 6am-7pm CST or via email at bpconsumer@bp.com at anytime. We appreciate your loyalty and patience in getting this resolved. - BPme Support Team\r", 'modified': '2019-12-04T22:57:33Z'}
review:
Edit: I see a developer response below saying I should contact support. Sorry guys if you had read the review you’d see I have multiple times. I see no point in emailing again when they’ve already responded with zero help. 

First it is unreliable. Second it’s a ripoff. Read on. 
   On many occasions I have had the app either refuse to acknowledge I am at a station or refuse to activate a pump. When you can’t rely on something it’s really worse than not having it. I kept using it for the extra discount... until at the end of a month I tried to fuel up all three cars only to have it randomly refuse to work for two of them. I lost my $100 spend because of that and therefore my extra discount. Contacting support was useless so the app went to app purgatory. 
   Until recently when I was towing a boat through an unfamiliar area and needed gas. There was that shiny green station, I read the cash/ credit prices and pulled in. My mistake. After filling up I see it charged me the credit price, even though I used their card through their app! A mistake I thought, I’ll just contact support! Support confirms this is actually their practice!
  Let me say that again for those not paying attention. If you use the BP app even with a BP card at a BP station you WILL BE CHARGED THE CREDIT PRICE. I’m officially done with this company.
title: Terrible for many reasons

review: Sometimes I connect , fast sometimes slow sometimes not at all. Same stations just depends whether they want me to use my rewards or not. I hope this is not the case but not that happy with BP me
Appreciate the savings for Vets & other discounts all with an easy to use app.

review:
As a product manager for a software company, I have dealt with my fair share of apps. I’m familiar with common bugs and issues and can usually navigate myself around them when they appear. I attempted at least a half dozen times to create a password for a new account unsuccessfully. I tried to sign in through Pay Pal and attempted to manually create a password. Neither worked. I attempted to use the “forgot password” function several times and it failed each time. The app insisted that I “could not use a previously used password” when, ironically, I was attempting to setup a password for the first time. 

In any case, I was never actually able to use the app so I cannot provide any insight to the functionality of the app itself. The fact that creating a new account from the app proved to be impossible for me earned this 1-star review.

review:
There is nothing good I can say about this application. Signed up through GasBuddy. The extra money off from GasBuddy did not work. Ok, fine. I get to the pump and attempt to add a credit card so I can pay for gas. Doesn’t work. I tried again, didn’t work. Tried to use my credit card at the pump, that didn’t work either. Gave up and went to the gas station I already had a loyalty membership with which is five miles closer to my home. While I was at the bp pump I saw that all new members should get the same extra money off as the GasBuddy discount, but this was not applied to my account. 

I am canceling. I don’t need my card attached to yet another account that could randomly pilfer money from me.

review: I think this app would be much more beneficial if you could get rewards without having to store your debit or credit card information. review:
You’re supposed to purchase $100/mo to maintain your discount.  With COVID and having fuel efficient cars, that’s not possible for us.  
Also had the issue of the application not activating the pump discount periodically at our local stations.
If you forget to close the application, it will quickly drain your battery.
Gas is currently $2.20/gal.  To get to $100, you would purchase approximately 45 gallons of fuel and save approximately $2.25.  I refuse giving the BPme application the opportunity to track me for that paltry incentive.
Uninstalled after two months.

review: This app intermittently works. When it does it’s easy. But this app more often fails than works. I was at a BP station and the app took awhile to find it. I can see all the cards I have listed. I even went into the gas station for assistance. The guy tells me to enter my credit card (which was already listed in the app). When I tried this I got the “something went wrong”. I tried two different cards, same error. I don’t have forever to troubleshoot at the pump and keep other customers from getting gas. So I lost my discount and my credit for using BP. This app should be seamless. It should just work. I would have done better just driving to a non-BP gas station instead of relying on this app my discount. This app needs much improvement.
