developerResponse: {'id': 21620738, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for providing feedback on BPme Rewards and BPme app. We very much value your business and hope to keep you as a loyal consumer. We are sorry that you are unhappy with this experience. We take your feedback seriously and will continue to look for ways to improve the experience for our best consumers. You can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further with your BPme account. Thanks, BPme team', 'modified': '2021-03-12T20:22:31Z'}
review:
It was nonstop problems with this whole system around this app.
First I was a member of the older BP Driver Rewards program, so I tried using my old login but that failed. Fine, I’ll re-register and forgive that I may have lost some reward credit from the old program. As I register, I need to give the account a password, I just tried to use the same password from the old program; turns out I could not use it because somehow the system remembered my old password for what was supposed to be a new registration. A bit annoying, not so bad to be one star.

When I register, I enter a promo code, which was accepted, but when I check the app, it just shows the regular $0.05 discount for no code. Annoying, but not one star annoying, and it’s a marketing thing, not the app per se. 

I do all that before I get to the gas station, so that I don’t waste time at the pump. I get to the gas station and try to use it. The pump doesn’t say much about how to proceed, so I just open the app. I click on the button to pay for fuel. The app cannot find my location. I check my settings. Location services are on. I check the BPme app, location services are on when using the app. I go back to the app, it still cannot find my location. I go to Station Finder, the app locks up. I kill the app and restart it, it is stuck on the splash screen (ie. the starting BPme logo screen) and won’t start. I have the latest iPhone Pro Max, for crying out loud! So far I have wasted minutes at a busy gas station trying to get this dump app to work! Now we are a one-star-land.

I decide to restart the phone. That takes a while. I get to the app, it starts. I go to pay for fuel, location is working now and I pick my pump number. I go to pay using Apple Pay, the app starts spinning and locks up again. Then says there’s an error processing payment. By now the gas station attendant is literally yelling at me over the speaker on the pump asking what is the problem. I respond and he yells the same question again. I guess he doesn’t hear me. I shake the phone so he can see it and point at it and say again that the app is not working. So I’m trying to pay, getting yelled at, looking at the BPme display fine print that I am expected to pay $0.99 a month to subscribe to this terrible experience. I’m thinking about how so many startups with far smaller revenue than BP churn out much better performing apps all day, every day. I just take out my credit card and pay the old fashioned way, and now have to figure out how to de-register because I am not paying a subscription for this. It’s one star because I can’t assign zero.
title: Proved Useless

review:
Although my debit card is approved when I prepay for gasoline at the register, the same card isn’t accepted moments before at the pump.

It’s not my responsibility to reconcile this quandary.

Why can’t I register payment methods with my identification so that I can FILL MY TANK COMPLETELY instead of guessing a $30 refill?

Sure, we ALL want payment security!

But when this same security defeats our ability to actually purchase, what have we gained?
title: Funding My Purchases...

developerResponse: {'id': 21952942, 'body': 'Hi there, we are sorry to hear about your experience and would love to look into this for you. You can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further. Thanks, BPme team', 'modified': '2021-03-30T15:21:58Z'}
review:
Aside from the poor self-documentation, it’s successfully unlocked a pump for me only about 1-in-5 tries.  Usually it errors out as unavailable, but once it reported that the system was down for scheduled maintenance...in the mid-afternoon!

Moreover, it has *never* credited me for any payments that I’ve made using the linked card...which makes it difficult to claim the monthly discount.

review:
Since the update that switched the login to a browser in a frame from app native, I’ve been unable to log in at all because cookies have to be enabled in the browser but every time the app calls the browser window in a frame, all cookie settings are refreshed.  That means even though I enabled cookies in the Safari app, that setting doesn’t apply in the app’s framed browser window.

So, this app is completely useless and I’ve heard nothing now two weeks after sending a support request.

review: Every time I try to login on the app I get an error message that gives me the choice of either retrying, calling or logging out. When I hit retry I get the same error message. When I try to call I’m told that the wait time is around 60 minutes. So then I tried to login on a laptop computer. I was able to login and then I get a screen telling me to pick the method I want to receive marketing messages either emails or text messages. developerResponse: {'id': 21246124, 'body': 'Hi Steve, we are sorry to hear about your experience and would love to look into this for you. It seems that you are experiencing some technical issues. For Technical support and troubleshooting assistance you can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further. Thanks, BPme Team', 'modified': '2021-02-23T19:05:40Z'}
review:
After a few days, I received an email saying that it would be 7-10 days more before they could get back to me. Two weeks later, after two app updates, I have heard nothing from anyone, and the app still doesnt work. I am done with the app, and done with BP 

This app doesn’t work. It comes back with a notice that they are having technical difficulties, again and again.  A week later...I again arrived at the pump and got the same error message that they were having technical difficulties. I called tech support and waited and waited for about 10 minutes getting constant messages that somebody would be with me shortly and again and again. I left the station and went home, about a 15 minute trip. When I got home I hung up. THE APP DOESN’T WORK AND TECH SUPPORT DOESN’T EITHER. Another day. I was going to ride past the BP station, so I called tech support before I got there. This time I got an answer, and the lady said since my problem was a “Technical Issue” my call would have to be escalated, and it would be 3-5 days before someone could call me back. If I were BP, I would be very embarrassed.
title: Non functional

developerResponse: {'id': 21997518, 'body': 'Hi there, we are sorry to hear about your experience and would love to look into this for you. If you download the BPme App and register for the BPme Rewards program, you will have the option in the App to link a credit or debit card of your choice to your rewards account. This feature provides you the option to swipe this same card at the pump without opening the App, and you will automatically receive your rewards and have the transaction credited to your monthly fuel spend.  Another option would be to enter your ALT ID (Phone number linked with your BPme account) at the pump and  you will receive your rewards. Also, for technical support and troubleshooting assistance you can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further. Thanks, BPme team', 'modified': '2021-04-01T15:37:58Z'}
review: Before, about 3-4 weeks ago, the app wouldn’t even open.  I would get an initial white loading screen and it would crash.  Now at least I can open the app, log in to the app, and do everything in the app, EXCEPT actually pay for gas via the app via PayPal.
title: Pay via app doesn’t work

developerResponse: {'id': 22098696, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear about your experience and we would love to look into this for you. You can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further. Thanks, BPme team", 'modified': '2021-04-07T11:24:54Z'}
review:
When the app works, it’s nice to sometimes save some money on gas, but more often than not, the app has issues. 

Between the pump not pumping after being unlocked, and the app thinking you’re not at a BP when you are, more often than not, this app is just a letdown.

The fact that on their own map, their locations aren’t accurate, and there’s no way to bypass the location check to apply your rewards has made me lose faith in BPs ability to provide even basic conveniences. After using this app and seeing how horribly thrown together it is, I feel like I’ll be specifically avoiding BP gas stations in the future.
title: Way too poorly made

title: Utterly useless

developerResponse: {'id': 22287904, 'body': 'Hi there, we are sorry to hear about your experience and would love to look into this for you. You can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further. Thanks, BPme team', 'modified': '2021-04-16T15:44:28Z'}
review: I’ve been a happy user of this app for a few years now, but not anymore. The app either won’t load, crashes on loading, doesn’t remember your login info (and Jebus forbid you forget your login password once or twice or you’ll be locked out for 15 minutes), or you magically get everything to open only for the app to tell you that it’s experiencing an issue connecting to the pumps. It’s now at the point that I’m not bothering to even buy gas at BP using my card the “old fashioned” way; I’m taking my business elsewhere.
title: Unusable - bye BP!

review: The app is great when it works, incentivizing payment with the app. I consider BP a premium product and the ability to pay without leaving my car seems like a premium idea. Unfortunately at several stations I get a “technical issues” error and can’t pay with the app. You get a discount using a linked card, but it’s less than half the discount of using a linked card through the app (5c versus 11c). There’s zero customer support for the app. Emails say you get a reply in 12 business hours, but my email from this weekend hasn’t been answered three full business days later. It’s a shame that it’s making me think less of the product as a whole because of that lack of standing behind the product.
title: Great (when it works) but zero customer support

review: Price Match doesn’t work. The closed gas station to the BP I go to is always 5 to 10 cents cheaper. BP says it uses GasBuddy for price matching. developerResponse: {'id': 22468819, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for taking the time to share your valuable feedback. If you need any assistance, you can contact our support team at 1-800-333-3991 and they will do their best to assist you further. Thanks, BPme team', 'modified': '2021-04-26T18:31:49Z'}
review: The app is a bit clunky and inefficient. It should be clearer where to go to locate your station and fuel, especially in larger cities where you have multiple BP locations on the map in a close proximity to each other and/or are located on the same street.  Part of the problem is that the stations should be better set up to accommodate app usage by clearly displaying the pump number and address while you’re sitting in your car — otherwise, why stand at a pump to work through each step of the app when you can just quickly swipe your card?  It would also be helpful to have clear confirmation of each step in the process to guide you through each step. The 5 cent/gallon discount is especially insignificant when it requires a minimum amount of spend each month - especially in the era of COVID when people are driving less and using less gas.
title: Clunky and Inefficient UX

Possibly the singular worst setup experience I’ve ever had on iOS. The app link to email doesn’t work, the app link from email back doesn’t work. The password entry screen has no way to reload if it freezes. There is no paste functionality in the CC entry screen. I guarantee this was not worth the $10 credit I was offered to sign in. I can only hope the usage experience is better. If it is, I’ll add star(s) back.

Update - used the app for the first time. Had to drive to two different pumps to make it work as the first pump timed out (hung in the "waiting" mode while trying to select a grade) and was unusable. Second pump worked, luckily the station was empty or the failure would have been really annoying and awkward. The pump was still out if service when I left after filling up 5 min later.

review: You have convinced me to get the application. Only due to already being a BP rewards member before. I did everything that the app asked for and now it’s not working. You all should have made sure that the app will work correctly before having people enter the program and downloading the app. Sometimes what was not broken did not need to be fixed. I was satisfied with using my rewards card and it was that simple. How can this be fixed? Please and thank you
title: Dissatisfied

review: It’s nice designed app, but I would avoid using “Pay for fuel” function. I have paid using this function today at the pump. The pump got activated and it charged me $100 right away using Apply Pay. I did not pump any fuel yet, so hoped it some kind of crazy high pre-authorization and it will adjust the balance. Then the pump was just not responding to start fueling process, allowing me to select only a fuel grade and nothing else. The cancel button got grayed out in the app, so I was not able to cancel it, but I was not able to get any fuel either. I called gas station workers and they were not able to help me either, since that transaction was initiated using that app and they din’t have a control over it. Wrokers agree to block that pump, so no one else can use that pre-authorized pending transaction and gave me a 800 BP number to call to find out  how to refund $100 charge. So, instead of spending 5 min to fuel my car, I spend 40 min and got charged for $100 for nothing. I’m sure once I will call 800 number they will refund my money, but don’t use “Pay for fuel”, you might spend much more time than you expect.
title: «Pay for fuel” function is not reliable

review: I’ve used this app since it came out. Lately noticed a trend that I disagree with. With BP closing lots of gas stations, the few that are left in my area are charging a $0.10 fee for credit. So I use the app to save $0.05  but I get hit with a $0.10 charge per gallon for using credit. Ultimately I get penalized for using the app, in the tune of $0.05 per gallon. I’m better off just using my debit card and getting charged for the cash prize. Come on BP this is not how you do a rewards program to increase customer loyalty. I sent an inquiry to BP and was told that I got my $0.05 off and there was no issue. Missed my whole point. Oh well, I guess I will be a Shell customer going forward.
title: Does it really save $ ?
